snippet: A new study finds that drastic cuts in fishing quotas have not helped cod recover because rising temperatures have also decreased reproduction and increased mortality.
abstract: Study published in journal Science finds rising temperatures in Gulf of Maine are one of main contributing factors to collapse of cod fishing industry in New England; findings could explain why fish population has not recovered despite severe limits on fishing for cod; some marine experts praise study for highlighting challenges climate change poses for management of fisheries.
lead_paragraph: A new study finds that drastic cuts in fishing quotas have not helped cod recover because rising temperatures have also decreased reproduction and increased mortality.

headline.print_headline: Cod’s Failure to Recover Is Linked to Warming Gulf of Maine
headline.main: Cod’s Continuing Decline Linked to Warming Gulf of Maine Waters
